text:
“Very well, let us go,” Raskolnikov said.

Sonia smiled. “He will be glad to meet you. I spoke of you yesterday.”

“Sofya Semyonovna,” he corrected. “This is my friend Razumihin. He is a good man.”

Sonia looked down, embarrassed. “If you have to go now…”

“Let us go,” Raskolnikov decided. “Where do you live?”

She flushed and gave her address. They stepped out together.

“Don’t you lock up?” Razumihin asked.

“Never,” Raskolnikov replied. “People are happy without locks.” He laughed.

“Do you go to the right, Sofya Semyonovna?” 

“How did you find me?” he asked, wanting to meet her gaze.

“Polenka gave me your address yesterday.”

“Polenka? Oh, yes, the little girl. She is your sister?”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov and Sonia discuss their acquaintance and plans to meet, revealing a growing connection between them.
